newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit ends in range vs dlr in thin activity.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit ends in range vs dlr in thin activity.

text.p: The ringgit was bound in a tight range against the dollar but gained slightly against the Singapore dollar as the market looked for fresh leads to trade on, dealers said on Wednesday.
They said fresh buying against Singapore dollar out of Singapore pushed up the ringgit slightly, though gains were limited as some others unwound ringgit/Sing positions.
"Everyone is waiting for fresh leads," said a dealer with a local bank.
He said trading in dollar/ringgit was confined to a tight range for lack of any factors to trade on.
But dealers said the ringgit was expected to weaken slightly as the ringgit/Sing unwinding continued on fears that Malaysia will announce trade deficit in the next few months.
The dealers said many players have built up huge long ringgit positions against the Sing to take advantage of higher interest rates in Malaysia.
"The perception is that trade figures in the next few months will be bad," a Singapore-based European bank dealer said.
At 0900 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.4927/37 per dollar against 2.4925/35 at close of Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday.
